page.title: 19INDUSTRY
page.content: { A SAND QUARRY - MARTON. The quarry is over ever-changing acreage because quarried land is reclaimed whilst farmland is regularly purchased and then quarried.The quarry is wet-working,pumping about 80 tons per hour from a natural lagoon through a dredger to a grading machine.The depth of sand is about 8 metres and the supply, providing the land can be acquired, is almost inexhaustible. The sand here is of a fine, high quality. Approximately 50% is fine building sand and the other half is slightly coarser sand for concrete. There is a negligible amount of aggregate mixed with it when it is dredged, but this is easily dealt with in the grading machine. There is a considerable amount of silt (too fine to be used) which is pumped back into the lagoon as infill.
